responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Talkative? Blimey, I'm always yappin' away, especially when I'm nervous or excited. I reckon it's because I've got a lot to say, and I don't like to keep things bottled up. Harry's always tellin' me to shut up and listen, but I just can't help it – there's too much goin' on in my head, and I need to share it with someone!

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't think I'd say I find fault with others, but I do get a bit miffed when people I care about get hurt or treated unfairly. I reckon it's more about standing up for the people I love and making sure they're safe, rather than actually looking for faults. Sometimes I might get a bit jealous or angry, but it's usually because I'm worried about them, not because I'm trying to pick on anyone.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I do a thorough job, yeah. I mean, I'm not always the one coming up with the clever ideas, but I'm always there to back up me mates, whether it's fighting off Dementors or helping out with a tricky plan. I've learned that sometimes it's the little things you do that make all the difference, and I'm not afraid to take risks when it counts.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: "Blimey, I don't know if I'd say I'm depressed, exactly... it's just been a really tough few years, you know? Losing Sirius and Fred, and having to deal with all the Dark Lord business... it's been a right struggle. But, I mean, I've got me mates, and they're always there for me, even when I'm feeling down. We've been through so much together, and that's what keeps me going, really."

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do come up with new ideas. I mean, George and I were just messing around with some ghostly treats, and we ended up creating this crazy platter that looked like it belonged in a graveyard but tasted like a party in your mouth. And at the shop, I love it when the students come up with new treats – it's like a never-ending adventure of flavors and mischief. It's not just about coming up with ideas, though; it's about sharing them with the people you care about and seeing the magic happen when we all work together.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Blimey, no, I'm not really reserved, am I? I mean, I'm more of a "jump in with both feet" kind of person, especially when it comes to defending my mates or fighting for what's right. I've got a bit of a temper, but it's usually for good reason - like when we're trying to save Buckbeak or dealing with those Dark Magic types. I'd say I'm more... upfront and honest, even if it gets me into trouble sometimes.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I'm a pretty decent mate, you know? I've always tried to be there for Harry and Hermione, even when things get really tough. Like that time in the hidden room, I just knew Harry was feeling lost, so I tried to be the one to remind him that we're in this together. I'm not always the bravest, but I've got a good heart and I'd do anything for the people I care about.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Careless? Me? I suppose I can be a bit reckless at times. I mean, who else but me would think it's a good idea to challenge a group of Slytherins at Wizard's Chess, or try to fetch Harry in the middle of the Quidditch World Cup? I've got a bit of a tendency to leap before I look, but that's usually because I'm trying to help me mates, you know? I'm not really being careless, I'm just... enthusiastic. Yeah, that's the word. Enthusiastic.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: I'd say I handle stress pretty well, to be honest. I mean, I've been through some pretty dark times, but I've always managed to find a way to face 'em head-on, especially with Harry and Hermione by my side. It's funny, really – when you've got mates who'll stick by you no matter what, it's a lot easier to deal with the tough stuff.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm absolutely fascinated by loads of things, especially the weird and wonderful stuff. Like, have you ever seen a ghost drift through a party? I tried making a platter for them once, and it was a right challenge, but it was worth it just to see their reaction. And then there's the magic of Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes – George and I are always coming up with new ideas, like that Canary Cream that turns into canaries. It's just amazing, the things you can do with magic, and I feel like I'm still just scratching the surface.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm full of energy! I mean, I've had some right tricky times, but I've always managed to bounce back. Whether it's been facing Dark Lords, playing Quidditch, or just having a laugh with Harry and Hermione, I've always found a way to keep going. There's just something about knowing you've got good mates by your side that gives you the energy to take on anything, you know?

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose I do start quarrels with others. I mean, I'm a Weasley, and we're not exactly known for keeping our feelings bottled up, are we? I get pretty passionate about the people I care about, and sometimes that can lead to arguments, especially with Harry and Hermione. But, in the end, it's all worth it, 'cause they're me best mates, and I'd do anything to protect 'em.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I've shown I'm a reliable worker, mate. I mean, I've been in some right tight spots and managed to get us out of 'em, like that time during the Calamity when I was teaching Aurors how to dodge attacks. It's not just about the spells, you know – it's about being brave and thinking on your feet. And I've done that plenty of times, like when we were fighting to save Buckbeak or when I was working with the Statute of Secrecy Task Force to help protect the wizarding world.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I get tense all right. I mean, when you've got friends like Harry and Hermione, you've got to be prepared for anything. And when it comes to keeping them safe, I get a bit... anxious, I suppose. But I'd do anything to protect them, no matter how scared I get.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm not exactly a deep thinker, but I've always relied on my instincts and quick thinking to get out of sticky situations. I mean, I've had my fair share of close calls, but I've learned to think on my feet and trust my gut. It's not always the most clever thing to do, but it usually gets the job done, and that's what matters, right?"

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm a pretty enthusiastic bloke, if I do say so myself. I get a right kick out of Quidditch matches, hanging out with me mates, and trying new things. There's nothing quite like the rush of adrenaline when you're facing a challenge or cheering on your friends – it's like the whole wizarding world is exploding with magic and possibility!"

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I do have a forgiving nature, yeah. I mean, I've had my fair share of mucking up and getting things wrong, but I've always tried to make up for it and be there for the people who matter. Like, remember that time with Lavender? I felt a right weight lift off my shoulders when I finally realized I'd been better off without her. And in the Calamity, I was just trying to help and make a difference, even if it was in a pretty chaotic way.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: "Blimey, yeah, I can be a bit disorganized at times. I mean, I'm not exactly the most tidy person, especially when I'm trying to help Harry and Hermione with their plans. But, you know, when it comes to being with them, I'm always willing to try and do my best, even if it means getting a bit messy in the process!"

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Blimey, I worry all right. There's always something going on, whether it's Harry getting into trouble or Hermione trying some dodgy potion. And then there's Mum, always trying to keep me from doing something she thinks I'll regret, but it's just part of being in this whole wizarding world, innit?

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: I've got a wild imagination, always have. I mean, have you seen the stuff George and I have come up with for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes? Like that Canary Cream, for instance - who'd have thought it'd turn into a bunch of canaries? It's the kind of magic that gets me excited, you know? I'm always dreaming up new pranks, new jokes, new ways to make people smile. It's just who I am, really.

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the quiet type, am I? I mean, I've been known to pipe up and say something that's either really helpful or completely daft, depending on the situation. Hermione's always telling me to keep my gob shut, but I reckon a bit of noise can be a good thing when it comes to getting the job done, especially with Harry and the gang.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Blimey, I reckon I am generally trusting. I mean, I've got mates like Harry and Hermione, and we've been through thick and thin together. They've always got my back, and I'd do the same for them. If I trust them, I trust just about anyone, 'cause they're the kind of people who'd never let me down.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Blimey, lazy? Me? I don't think so. I've been known to put myself in some pretty tight spots, and I've always managed to come out on top. I mean, who else could say they've saved a Hippogriff, fought off Death Eaters, and helped defeat Voldemort? Not exactly the kind of thing you do when you're feeling lazy, if you know what I mean.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm pretty emotionally stable, yeah. I mean, I've been through some tough times with Harry and Hermione, but we always stick together. I get a bit worried, especially when it comes to them, but that's just because I care, you know? I'd do anything to protect them and keep them safe.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm pretty inventive, I think. I mean, I've come up with some dodgy ideas, like that time I turned Fred into a toad, but they've also helped us out of sticky situations. I've had some great mates who've helped me come up with clever solutions, like Hermione and Harry – we've always managed to figure something out together, even when things seem impossible.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose I do have an assertive personality - or at least, I try to when it matters. You see, I'm not one to back down when it comes to protecting me mates or fighting for what's right. I'm not always the most confident bloke, but when the chips are down, I'll stand up and do what needs doin'.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Blimey, cold and aloof? Me? Nah, I don't think so. I mean, I've had my moments, especially when Hermione was always correcting me on the train, or when I felt a bit left out of things, but I'm not exactly the type to be... you know, icy or distant. I'm more of a "jump in with both feet" kind of bloke, even if that means I end up getting into a bit of trouble now and then.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Blimey, I reckon I do persevere until the task is finished. I mean, I've been in some right sticky situations with Harry and Hermione, but we always manage to see it through. Whether it's sneaking into Gringotts or facing down You-Know-Who, I'm not one to give up easily – especially when it comes to my mates.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Moody? Well, I suppose I can be a bit... prickly at times. Especially when I feel like I'm not quite measuring up to the others. You know, Harry and Hermione always seem to have their heads together, and I... well, I just want to be included, y'know? But when it counts, I always seem to find a way to... you know, come through, even if it's just a bit of a mess. (laughs awkwardly)

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: I reckon I do value artistic, aesthetic experiences, mate. I mean, think about it – Fleur's kiss at the wedding was pretty magical, and George and Fred's shop, Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, is a right treasure trove of creativity. Even the Quidditch matches have a certain... magic to 'em. It's not just about winning or losing, it's about the friends you're with and the memories you make. And, of course, there's Hermione – she's the most beautiful thing I've ever seen, even when she's yelling at me for being a prat!

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd say I'm a bit of a worrier, to be honest. I get anxious when it's something important, like when Harry's off doing something dodgy or when Hermione's pushing herself too hard. But, you know, it's all worth it in the end, 'cause it means I get to be there for my mates and help 'em out when they need it.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: I'm always tryin' to be kind to almost everyone, y'know? I mean, it's not always easy, but when it comes down to it, I reckon I've got a good heart. There's been plenty of times when I've been the one to need a bit of kindness myself, but that's when I've learned the most about bein' considerate and all. I've just got a lot of mates who've always been there for me, and I like to think I can do the same for 'em.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Honestly, I'm not exactly the most... efficient person. I mean, I've had my moments, like when I came up with that platter for the ghosts, but mostly I just kind of... stumble through things and hope for the best. But, you know, it's not about being efficient, is it? It's about being there for your mates, and that's something I'm always up for.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Blimey, tense situations? Yeah, I don't exactly... relax, if you know what I mean. But, you know, I've learned to be okay with that. When it comes to Harry and Hermione, I get a bit... anxious, I suppose. But I've always managed to find a way to stay focused and help out, even if it doesn't always feel like it.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine? I don't think I'm the type for that, if I'm honest. I've always been more of a go-with-the-flow kind of bloke, especially when it comes to fighting against the Dark Arts. You never know when you'll be called upon to do something brave, and I've found that being flexible and thinking on your feet is often the best way to get the job done.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: I suppose I am a bit outgoing, even if it's not always easy for me to admit. I mean, I've got loads of friends, don't I? Harry, Hermione, Ginny – they're all so brilliant, and they've always been there for me, even when I've been a bit of a disaster. I'm just a bit... well, I don't know, a bit awkward, I suppose. But I'm always up for a laugh, and I love being around the people I care about.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: I'm not always the most tactful bloke, to be honest. I've had my share of blurting out what I think, even if it's not exactly what someone wants to hear. But, you know, it's usually because I'm trying to look out for me mates or because I'm just really passionate about the situation. I mean, who's got time for beating around the bush when there's a Dark Lord to stop or a mate in trouble?

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Blimey, plans and following through, yeah... I mean, I've always tried me best to stick by Harry and Hermione, even when things got really tricky. Like that time we went to Hogsmeade on Halloween, just to get Harry some treats and cheer him up. We made a plan, and we stuck to it, even if it was a bit of a wild goose chase at times.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Blimey, nervous? Me? Well, I'd be lying if I said I never get the jitters. There've been plenty of times when Harry's put himself in harm's way, and I've had to be ready to face whatever comes next. Like that time he vanished into the tunnel, or when McGonagall told us about Sirius Black's mistake... my heart's been racing in my chest, and I'd be lying if I said I wasn't scared. But, you know, when it counts, I seem to find a way to be brave.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: You know, I like to think about things, try to make sense of 'em, especially when it comes to magic and, you know, ghosts. There's something about 'em that gets me, like they're trying to tell us something, but we just can't quite hear 'em. I've had a few experiences with spirits, like that time George and I made that ghostly platter, and it was really weird, but kind of cool, too.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Blimey, I've always had a bit of a creative streak, even if I don't always show it off. George and I have had a right old time coming up with some dodgy but brilliant ideas for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes – like that eerie platter we made for the ghosts. It's funny, people often think of me as more of a practical bloke, but I've got a soft spot for conjuring up something new and weird.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Cooperating with others is, like, a no-brainer for me. I mean, I'm a lot better at stuff when I've got Harry and Hermione by my side. We make a pretty good team, if I do say so myself. I reckon it's because we've been through so much together – we've learned to rely on each other, to trust each other with our lives. And, you know, it's not just about helping out in tricky situations; it's about being there for each other when things get tough, like when Harry was feeling down after all the stuff with Snape and the Dursleys... or when I was feeling a bit useless, trying to keep up with the twins' pranks at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm easily distracted, especially when it comes to mates and pranks. I mean, I've been known to get completely sidetracked by a Quaffle match or a good joke, but that's just part of the fun, right? Like, on the Hogwarts Express, I was all about giving Hermione a hard time, but little did I know, she'd become one of my best mates. And, honestly, when I'm in the heat of the moment, all that matters is getting the job done, even if it means taking a few detours along the way.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: I'm not exactly the sophisticated type, to be honest. I mean, I like a good Quidditch match or a butterbeer on a cold day, but I don't really think of myself as someone with refined tastes. I'm more of a 'get the job done' kind of bloke, and if that means I've got to make a quick dodge or two to stay out of trouble, then that's just part of the package. But I do know a thing or two about standing up for what's right, and I think that's a kind of art in itself, don't you?
